job description:
The BioMedicine Design (BMD) department is seeking a contractor in the Molecular Design, Profiling and Production group supporting the development of an antibody properties database to gain a greater understanding of chemical liabilities. The scientist will be generating experimental data for a library of rational designed antibodies to support computational modeling effort. In addition, the qualified scientist will be responsible for additional biophysical characterizations to ensure these variants retain the desired stability criteria.
  • Molecular assessment of the rational design variants using various biophysical and analytics techniques such as iCE, DSC and aSEC
  • Set up and carry out the forced degradation studies
  • Manage the forced degradation database including protein samples inventory, protein sequences and assay results into an Excel database
Skills:
  • BA/BS with 1-2 years of relevant biochemistry experience
  • Effective bench scientist; proficient in a range of general lab techniques including dialysis and UV spectroscopy
  • Knowledgeable in biophysical techniques such as iCE, DSC and SEC
  • Detail oriented and organized
  • Able to grasp complex procedures and adapt appropriately
  • Ability to complete experiments with limited supervision
  • Experience with using Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
  • Excellent communication skills

  • *open to Masters with experience obtained through school
